comments:
Created an attachment (id=79297)
jsp file to reproduce the error

Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1. right click on the JSP (jsp file attached to this bug) and select open with
2. select Web Page Editor
3. NullPointerException occurs


More information:
The exception does not occur with all JSPs. The attached jsp was previously created with Exadel plugin.

Stack trace:

Created an attachment (id=83529)
A smaller file that reproduces the same error.

I attached a smaller file that causes the same error. I also discovered that if you follow these steps:

1 - Open file in normal JSP editor
2 - Comment all the file
3 - Close it
4 - Reopen with Web Editor
5 - Uncomment the file

The error doesn't happen, so I think the error happens only when opening a JSP file formated in a certain way.

I just discovered that the exact line in my smaller file that causes the error is this line:

<iframe name="frameConteudo" src="cad_demanda.jsf" frameborder="0" id="iframe_sistema" ></iframe>

This is in line 29. I think there's an error when trying to render frames.

(In reply to comment #5)
Thanks for narrowing the problem. We will address this in the 3.0 release. Please mark this bug as critical if you need thsi fixed before that.

Well, I discovered a workaround, at least for me. I took the problematic tag 

<iframe name="frameConteudo" src="cad_demanda.jsf" frameborder="0"
id="iframe_sistema" ></iframe> 

and put it between the <f:subview> tag, so the end result was:

<f:subview>
  <iframe name="frameConteudo" src="cad_demanda.jsf" frameborder="0"
id="iframe_sistema" ></iframe>
</f:subview>

This solved the problem, it no longer gives the NullPointerException error. So for me I can wait for the 3.0 release. If someone else is still having this problem even after this workaround I think it should be wise to mark this bug as critical.
